title: Causes of the War
objectives: Analyze the long-term causes of World War II including the Treaty of Versailles, the Great Depression, and the rise of totalitarian regimes.
Identify the roles of key leaders (e.g., Hitler, Mussolini, Emperor Hirohito) in the path to global conflict.
Examine how nationalism, expansionism, and fascism contributed to tensions in Europe and Asia.
Evaluate the failure of appeasement and the role of the League of Nations.
Understand the invasion of Poland in 1939 and its immediate trigger effect on the war.

title: Major Campaigns (European Theater)
objectives: Trace the major military campaigns in the European theater: Blitzkrieg, Battle of Britain, Operation Barbarossa, and D-Day.
Understand the strategic significance of Allied and Axis moves in Western and Eastern Europe.
Analyze the impact of air warfare, naval blockades, and tank battles on the course of the war.
Explore the role of resistance movements and underground operations across occupied countries.
Study the liberation of Paris and the final push into Nazi Germany.

title: The Pacific Theater
objectives: Identify the key battles in the Pacific: Pearl Harbor, Midway, Guadalcanal, Iwo Jima, and Okinawa.
Understand Japan’s imperial goals and their expansion across Asia.
Examine the role of island-hopping strategy and its impact on the war’s progression.
Explore the use of kamikaze tactics and the cultural influences behind them.
Evaluate the decision to drop atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki and the controversy surrounding it.

title: Consequences and Aftermath
objectives: Analyze the immediate and long-term consequences of WWII on global politics and society.
Understand the creation of the United Nations and the beginning of the Cold War.
Explore the impact of the Holocaust and the Nuremberg Trials in establishing human rights standards.
Evaluate the economic rebuilding of Europe under the Marshall Plan and Japan’s post-war transformation.
Examine the decolonization wave and the shifting global balance of power.
